nihss.title: NIHSS Stroke Scale
nihss.description: Assess stroke severity using the NIHSS scale.
nihss.q2_example: 0: Normal, 1: Partial gaze palsy, 2: Forced deviation
nihss.q3_example: 0: No visual loss, 1: Partial hemianopia, 2: Complete hemianopia, 3: Bilateral blindness
nihss.q4_example: 0: Normal, 1: Minor paralysis, 2: Partial paralysis, 3: Complete paralysis
nihss.q5_example: 0: No drift, 1: Drift, 2: Some effort against gravity, 3: No effort against gravity, 4: No movement
nihss.q6_example: 0: No drift, 1: Drift, 2: Some effort against gravity, 3: No effort against gravity, 4: No movement
nihss.q7_example: 0: No ataxia, 1: Present in one limb, 2: Present in two limbs
nihss.q8_example: 0: Normal, 1: Mild to moderate sensory loss, 2: Severe sensory loss
nihss.q9_example: 0: No aphasia, 1: Mild aphasia, 2: Severe aphasia, 3: Mute
nihss.q11_example: 0: No neglect, 1: Partial neglect, 2: Complete neglect

phq9.title: PHQ-9 Depression Assessment
phq9.description: Evaluate depression severity using the PHQ-9 questionnaire.
phq9.q1: Little interest or pleasure in doing things
phq9.q3: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
phq9.q4: Feeling tired or having little energy
phq9.q6: Feeling bad about yourself or that you are a failure
phq9.q8: Moving or speaking slowly or being restless
